name: (C) Ref. Case Other Fossil Furnace & AC
_description: Ref. case oil furnace operating with residential-type central or window AC plus ventilation

energy_efficiency_source.notes: See residential furnace performance. Typical value for performance, converted to Scout units where necessary.
energy_efficiency_source.source_data: Buildings Annual Technology Baseline. NREL, forthcoming

installed_cost_source.notes: Typical efficiency costs for residential furnaces in 2023, normalized by capacity
installed_cost_source.source_data: Buildings Annual Technology Baseline. NREL, forthcoming

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average of typical commercial oil furnace lifetime

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies: Appendix A
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Admnistration

notes: Heating multiple of 21% was determined by dividing square feet in which main heating equipment is oil or propane furnace (961852 sf) by square feet in switch main heating equipment is oil or propane furnace or packaged unit (4543002 sf)

cooling multiple of 37% was determined by dividing square feet in which cooling equipment is residential split system or individual AC unit AND heating equipment is not natural gas or electric (13428155 sf) by square feet with same cooling constraint and heating across all fossil fuel types (36556957 sf). Ventilation multiples determined by square feet in which given ventilation system (VAV or CAV) is paired with given heating system for the measure.
